I've been making poppers for over ten years and using for 13 years.  I use no other drugs, never have, never will.  I don't do cigs, alcohol, dope....etc...just poppers.  I'm health conscious and prefer feeling sober/normal 99.9% of the time.   Poppers have such a fleeting effect, that they have the huge advantage of maximum control regarding dose.  Whereas, when you inject or drink a drug, you have to let it run its course.  You could be under the influence for hours or days.   With poppers, once the last whiff is taken, the effects should be gone in less a few minutes.    I have found that the amyl group of poppers give the least side effects.... bad effects that can last hours or days.  Isopropyl nitrite always drops my blood pressure to levels that make me feel terrible.   Happens in less than 10 minutes and thereafter I can't take another whiff, not even a tiny one.   The butyl group(iso and n-butyl) causes less side effects than isopropyl nitrite, but they can still cave blood pressure, in less than 30 minutes.  Some of the unwanted side effects, such as headache, are due to impurities, such as acid and other degradation products, but there are a whole host of possible impurities.  A well made popper, suitable for inhalation and recreation,  should NOT have any unpleasant effect.

There are a few reason something gets researched.
1. Researchers own interest.

3. Government research (this includes military research)

True the research isn’t robust. But there is enough to know that the relative risks of poppers are actually quite low. The fact that don’t see many emergency department, hospital, other case studies or autopsies finding associations with poppers doesn’t just mean we “aren’t studying it,” it means these drugs aren’t really commonly presenting to medical care, ie complications are simply not common. So. We do already know they’re not that dangerous. Sure, there’s some risks, and some concerns. Would be lovely to have more studies and learn more…but, your tone in this video is full of melodrama and warnings and fear mongering. This kind of thought is WHY poppers are underground and unregulated and sold as “vinyl cleaner.” If we had more open and honest discussions about poppers instead of fear mongering them like they’re heroine, they might be safely produced and regulated rather than sold by dodgy magazine stores without quality control.
